intro: Sisymbrium hesperidiflorum, commonly known as the western field pennycress, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium hesperidiflorum is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and its role in soil stabilization.
